actor: Merced Community Medical Center Clinical Team

raiz.id: Merced Community Medical Center Clinical Team_0_0
raiz.texto: The medical team diagnosed Lia with severe epilepsy requiring a complex multi-drug anticonvulsant regimen that was adjusted numerous times over four years as seizures continued. The physicians believed strict medication compliance was essential to prevent progressive brain damage from uncontrolled seizures—each grand mal seizure potentially causing cumulative neurological harm. When the family repeatedly failed to administer medications as prescribed—giving inconsistent doses, stopping medications when Lia appeared overly sedated or 'not herself', and prioritizing traditional healing ceremonies—the medical team faced an ethical and legal dilemma. They interpreted the pattern as medical neglect that endangered Lia's life and neurological function. After multiple unsuccessful attempts to improve compliance through education and simplified regimens, they reported to Child Protective Services, resulting in Lia's placement in foster care on two occasions. The team maintained that their primary obligation was to Lia's physical health and that preventing brain damage through seizure control must take precedence over accommodating cultural practices that interfered with proven medical treatment.
